docs.snippet: Most analysts agree that SoftBank faces long odds as it seeks to compete in the American mobile market, but the company’s chief has been successful in taking on giant companies — and coming out on top....
docs.lead_paragraph: Most analysts agree that SoftBank faces long odds as it seeks to compete in the American mobile market, but the company’s chief has been successful in taking on giant companies — and coming out on top.
docs.abstract: SoftBank chief executive Masayoshi Son is confident of plan to break into American mobile market with $21.6 billion bid to buy Sprint, along with its Clearwire unit; most analysts agree that SoftBank, one of Japan's biggest companies, faces long odds of competing in United States, but Son is undeterred.

headline.main: Confidence From Chief of SoftBank in Sprint Bid
headline.print_headline: Confidence From Chief Of SoftBank In Sprint Bid
